item.title: Routing Traffic Within Your Kubernetes Cluster : Ingress-Nginx Controller
item.description: I recently had to setup an Ingress in one of the Kubernetes cluster of my job, so I wrote a short explanation for my colleagues that are not aware of Kubernetes Ingresses and since it provide usefull explanations on it I figured I’ll also share it here : Classic Ingress in Kubernetes An Ingress in Kubernetes is an object that makes microservices available outside the cluster. It routes incoming requests to the appropriate services, much like a traditional load balancer.
